title: Undefined symbols from flex
body:
I'm trying to add a package for something that depends on flex, but it's generating the following error message:

```
configure:10912: checking for flex
configure:10928: found /home/ajstewart/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.1.1/flex-2.6.0-w6wseh5ilzsol36gf4bwo645u3ovounz/bin/flex
configure:10939: result: flex
configure:10977: flex conftest.l
flex: fatal internal error, exec of /home/ajstewart/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.1.1/m4-1.4.17-wrmoocrr55qzqy2es3hjsubmk54hwcn5/bin/m4 failed
flex: error writing output file lex.yy.c
```

When I checked, I noticed the flex library has some undefined symbols:

```
$ ldd -r /home/ajstewart/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.1.1/flex-2.6.0-w6wseh5ilzsol36gf4bwo645u3ovounz/lib/libfl.so
    linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007ffd5375a000)
    libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007fe038f38000)
    libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00007fe038b76000)
    /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000560ace3e8000)
undefined symbol: yylex (/home/ajstewart/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.1.1/flex-2.6.0-w6wseh5ilzsol36gf4bwo645u3ovounz/lib/libfl.so)
```

Does anyone know how to solve this?
